description: Data was extracted from COSMIC in {---tag-release-month-year---}. This table contains all of the features related to a sample from the current release.

fields.name: sample_id
fields.description: COSMIC sample identifier; a sample is an instance of a portion of a tumour being examined for mutations; a number of samples can be taken from a single tumour and a number of tumours can be obtained from one individual; a sample id is used to identify a sample within the COSMIC database; there can be multiple ids, if the same sample has been entered into the database multiple times from different papers.

fields.name: sample_name
fields.description: The sample name can be derived from a number of sources.

fields.name: id_tumour
fields.description: COSMIC tumour identifier

fields.name: id_individual
fields.description: COSMIC individual identifier (aka patient/case)

fields.name: primary_site
fields.description: The primary tissue/cancer from which the sample originated. More details on the tissue classification are avaliable from http://cancer.sanger.ac.uk/cosmic/classification. In COSMIC we have standard classification system for tissue types and sub types because they vary a lot between different papers.

fields.name: site_subtype_1
fields.description: Further sub classification (level 1) of the samples tissue of origin.

fields.name: site_subtype_2
fields.description: Further sub classification (level 2) of the samples tissue of origin.

fields.name: site_subtype_3
fields.description: Further sub classification (level 3) of the samples tissue of origin.

fields.name: primary_histology
fields.description: The histological classification of the sample.

fields.name: histology_subtype_1
fields.description: Further histological classification (level 1) of the sample.

fields.name: histology_subtype_2
fields.description: Further histological classification (level 2) of the sample.

fields.name: histology_subtype_3
fields.description: Further histological classification (level 3) of the sample.

fields.name: therapy_relationship
fields.description: Relates the time-point of tissue sampling to the drug therapy used to treat the tumour.

fields.name: sample_differentiator
fields.description: Gives additional information if more than one sample (e.g. carcinomatous and sarcomatous components) from a tumour has been screened for mutations or if samples from a tumour were taken at different time points.

fields.name: mutation_allele_specification
fields.description: Where a publication has information on more than one mutation for one gene in a sample and reports whether or not the mutations occurred on the same or different chromosomes.

fields.name: msi
fields.description: If microsatellite instability data is given in the publication per sample then High, Low, Stable/Low, MSI or Stable is reported in COSMIC. Unknown is the default.

fields.name: average_ploidy
fields.description: The average ploidy of the sample, calculated from copy number data (where available).

fields.name: whole_genome_screen
fields.description: 'y' if the sample was whole genome screened

fields.name: whole_exome_screen
fields.description: 'y' if the sample was whole exome screened

fields.name: sample_remark
fields.description: Any additional sample information e.g. % mutant allele burden.

fields.name: drug_response
fields.description: Clinical and in vitro responses to drugs (particularly targeted drugs). Phrasing based on RECIST guidelines.  Note that in COSMIC, SD (stable disease) and PD (progressive disease) = clinical primary non response.

fields.name: grade
fields.description: Grade of tumour. The phrase 'Some Grade data are given in publication' is used when publication reports grade data or when data hasn't been given per sample. More detailed data follow commonly used grading systems in tumours.

fields.name: age_at_tumour_recurrence
fields.description: Where both primary and recurrent tumour samples from an individual have been screened for mutations and the age (in years) of the patient at the time of the recurrence is different to that at diagnosis.

fields.name: stage
fields.description: Stage of tumour. The phrase 'Some Stage data are given in publication' is used when publication reports stage data or when data hasn't been given per sample. More detailed data follow commonly used staging systems in tumours.

fields.name: cytogenetics
fields.description: Karyotype of the tumour.

fields.name: metastatic_site
fields.description: Tissue site of any metastases identified in an individual.

fields.name: tumour_source
fields.description: Source of tumour tissue sample e.g. primary, metastasis.

fields.name: tumour_remark
fields.description: Any additional tumour information e.g. metachronous tumour.

fields.name: age
fields.description: Age (in years) of individual at diagnosis.

fields.name: ethnicity
fields.description: Ethnicity (e.g. Caucasian) of individual.

fields.name: environmental_variables
fields.description: Environmental variables to which an individual has been exposed (e.g. viral exposure, smoking status).

fields.name: germline_mutation
fields.description: Gene name/mutation if a germline mutation as well as a somatic mutation has been detected in the same gene in the same tumour sample.

fields.name: therapy
fields.description: Any significant treatment an individual has received prior to mutation screening.

fields.name: family
fields.description: Any familial cancer history for an individual or familial relationships of individuals screened for mutations in the same publication.

fields.name: normal_tissue_tested
fields.description: If normal tissue from the same individual has been screened for mutations.

fields.name: gender
fields.description: Sex of individual.

fields.name: individual_remark
fields.description: Any additional individual information (e.g. age group, hereditary syndromes).

fields.name: nci_code
fields.description: NCI thesaurus code for tumour histological classification.

fields.name: sample_type
fields.description: Describes where the sample has originated from including the tumour type.

fields.name: cosmic_phenotype_id
fields.description: This is an ID to uniquely identify a sample based on primary tissue and primary histology.
